DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator for eligibilty criteria concerning the patient's recovery from prior therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: eligibilty criteria concerning the patient's recovery from prior events.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: gradual healing (through rest) after sickness or injury.

Concepts.definition: A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient recovered fro
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient recovered from the effects of recent surgery, radiotherapy or  chemotherapy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient recovered from the effects of recent surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient fully recovered from any surgical procedure prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient completely recovered from surgery with the incision completely healed and with no signs of infection

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient recovered from surgery with the incision completely healed and with no signs of infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient recovered from the effects of surgery, postoperative infection, and other complications within 14 days prior to step 2 registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient recovered from the effects of surgery, postoperative infection, and other complications within 28 days prior to step 2 registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient recovered from any effects of major surgery and is surgical wound healed prior to starting treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient healed from any prior surgery prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient recovered from the effects of recent surgery, radiotherapy or chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patients surgical or other wounds adequately healed prior to initiation of treatment?
